study_goal: The researchers aimed to review available evidence on treatment options for SCCIS, including cryotherapy, to evaluate its efficacy compared to other methods.
results_summary: The study found that no single treatment, including cryotherapy, was clearly superior for SCCIS, and further research is needed to define optimal protocols for nonsurgical methods like cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with squamous cell carcinoma in situ (SCCIS) on nongenital skin, particularly transplant recipients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current treatment modalities for trichiasis, including cryotherapy, and their complications.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the management options for trichiasis but does not provide specific results regarding its effectiveness or outcomes compared to other treatments. Recalcitrant or recurrent cilia are noted despite systematic approaches.
population_specificity: Patients with trichiasis (eyelash misdirection causing ocular surface irritation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a treatment method for cervical cancer in resource-constrained countries, comparing it with other screening and treatment approaches.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the primary treatment methods used in resource-constrained countries, alongside large loop excision of the transformation zone, but does not provide specific efficacy data or outcomes for cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Women in resource-constrained countries undergoing cervical cancer screening and treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficiency, patient tolerance, and aesthetic results of two cryopeeling methods (liquid nitrogen and portable system) for treating actinic keratoses on photodamaged skin.
results_summary: Liquid nitrogen (LN) showed higher efficiency (74%) than the portable system (PS, 62%), but PS had better patient tolerance. Both methods improved skin appearance, with no significant statistical difference in preference between the two.
population_specificity: Sixteen patients with multiple actinic keratoses on the forearms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the long-term outcomes and complication rates of cryotherapy in the management of colorectal liver metastases (CRLM).
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed local recurrence rates of 12-39%, with mean 1-, 3-, and 5-year survival rates of 84%, 37%, and 17%. Major complication rates ranged from 7% to 66%.
population_specificity: Patients with colorectal liver metastases (CRLM) deemed unsuitable for surgical resection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy plus ALA-PDT versus cryotherapy alone in treating multiple condylomata acuminata (CA).
results_summary: Cryotherapy plus ALA-PDT showed significantly higher complete response rates and lower recurrence rates in urethral meatus and external genitals compared to cryotherapy alone, though anal area results were similar. Adverse effects were mild to moderate, with no severe complications reported.
population_specificity: Eighty patients with multiple condylomata acuminata (CA).
effective_dosage: 20% ALA solution applied 3 hours before illumination with red light (635 nm, 100 mW/cm², 100 J/cm²).
study_duration: Two treatments, 7 days apart if lesions were not resolved.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential role of cryotherapy as a focal therapy for prostate cancer, assessing its ability to provide long-term cancer control with minimal morbidity compared to radical treatments.
results_summary: The study suggests that cryotherapy, as part of focal therapy, may offer a middle ground between active surveillance and radical treatment, combining minimal morbidity with cancer control and retreatment potential. However, more data from large trials are needed to confirm its safety and efficacy, particularly regarding the absence of viable cancer cells post-ablation.
population_specificity: Men with prostate cancer, particularly those with low-risk disease considered for active surveillance or focal therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and toxicity of periocular topotecan hydrochloride in fibrin sealant, with or without cryotherapy, for controlling intraocular retinoblastoma.
results_summary: Periocular topotecan in fibrin sealant showed efficacy in reducing tumor volume in small and recurrent retinoblastoma cases, enabling successful focal therapy in some patients, but failed in advanced cases (group D eyes). Minimal hematological toxicity was observed.
population_specificity: Eight children (10 eyes) with visually threatening or recurrent intraocular retinoblastoma.
effective_dosage: Median dose of 0.18 mg/kg (3.72 mg/m²), 1 to 4 injections.
study_duration: Median follow-up of 11 months after treatment (18 months since diagnosis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate changes in regression patterns of retinoblastoma following chemoreduction and tumor consolidation therapy (including cryotherapy).
results_summary: The study found that retinoblastoma regression patterns types 2 and 3 evolved over time, with type 2 scars either remaining stable or evolving into types 4, 3, or 1, and type 3 scars remaining stable or evolving into type 1. No changes were observed in types 0, 1, or 4 regression patterns.
population_specificity: 239 eyes of 157 patients with retinoblastoma.
study_duration: Mean follow-up period of 56 months (median 48 months; range 18-145 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a local destructive technique in the management of liver metastases from pancreatic endocrine tumors (PETs).
results_summary: The study mentions cryotherapy as one of several local destructive techniques used alongside surgical options for treating PET liver metastases, but it does not provide specific efficacy data for cryotherapy alone. The combination of various techniques, including cryotherapy, was noted to improve response and survival rates in advanced cases.
population_specificity: Patients with liver metastases from pancreatic endocrine tumors (PETs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical effectiveness of cryotherapy versus salicylic acid for treating plantar warts.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in effectiveness between cryotherapy and salicylic acid for plantar wart clearance at 12 weeks or six months, with similar patient satisfaction and time to clearance.
population_specificity: 240 patients aged 12+ with plantar warts suitable for both treatments.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy with liquid nitrogen, up to four treatments 2-3 weeks apart.
study_duration: Up to 12 weeks for primary outcome, six months for secondary outcomes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and role of cryotherapy as a treatment option for lentigo maligna, particularly for patients who cannot tolerate surgery.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy may be considered an option for treating lentigo maligna in patients who cannot undergo surgery, though it was not as strongly supported as staged surgical excision or Mohs micrographic surgery. The abstract does not provide detailed efficacy data for cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with lentigo maligna, particularly those who cannot tolerate surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent literature on endoscopic spray cryotherapy for treating Barrett's esophagus and esophageal cancer, focusing on its efficacy and safety.
results_summary: Spray cryotherapy showed high success rates for Barrett's esophagus (87-96% dysplasia eradication, 57-96% metaplasia eradication) and early-stage esophageal cancer (75% mucosal cancer elimination), with good patient tolerance. Limitations included small sample sizes and short follow-up periods.
population_specificity: Patients with Barrett's esophagus (high-grade dysplasia) and early-stage esophageal cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether percutaneous cryoablation combined with aerosolized granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor could induce systemic immune responses in patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma.
results_summary: The study found that cryoimmunotherapy induced tumor-specific cytotoxic T lymphocyte responses, antitumor antibody responses, and enhanced Th1 cytokine production in 4 of 6 patients, with immune responses correlating with clinical outcomes.
population_specificity: 6 patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (RCC).
study_duration: Immune responses were monitored up to 63 days post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy gel wrap improves skin microcirculation in individuals with chronic venous disorders, potentially preventing venous leg ulcers.
results_summary: The study found a statistically significant decrease in blood flow with cryotherapy, suggesting improved microcirculation, but no significant changes in skin temperature or venous refill time.
population_specificity: 60 participants (mean age 62, 70% female, 50% African American) with chronic venous disorders affecting lower leg skin.
effective_dosage: Daily 30-minute application of cryotherapy gel wrap.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether Hilotherapy, a novel cryotherapy method, could minimize ecchymosis, edema, hematoma, and pain after SMAS-based facelift surgery.
results_summary: Hilotherapy significantly reduced facial skin temperature but increased patient-reported swelling 6-8 days post-surgery. No significant differences were found in ecchymosis, hematoma, or pain between treated and untreated groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing SMAS-based facelift surgery.
effective_dosage: Not specified (single-use face masks circulating cooled, sterile water).
study_duration: 14 weeks (study duration; intervention duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review alternative strategies, including cryotherapy, for treating nonmelanoma skin cancers, particularly for poor surgical candidates or those prone to numerous cancers.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy's effects, only mentioning it as one of several traditional treatment options.
population_specificity: Patients with nonmelanoma skin cancers, especially poor surgical candidates or those prone to numerous cancers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if oral supplementation with a nutraceutical could enhance the response of cutaneous warts to conventional standard therapy (CST), including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The addition of nutraceutical OS significantly improved wart reduction and complete remission rates compared to CST alone, with fewer new warts developing in the combined treatment group. The effect was more pronounced in patients receiving topical therapy.
population_specificity: Adults and adolescents aged 14+ with a body weight ≥40 kg and at least one cutaneous viral wart.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of cryoablation in treating primary and secondary bone tumors, particularly when combined with cementoplasty to prevent pathological fractures.
results_summary: The study found that cryoablation, when used with cementoplasty, is effective for pain palliation and preventing fractures in spinal or acetabular tumors, though it noted the rare but severe "cryoshock phenomenon" as a potential adverse event.
population_specificity: Patients with primary or secondary bone tumors, including localized spinal tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical effectiveness and safety of primary prophylactic interventions, including cryotherapy, for preventing retinal detachment in untreated eyes of patients with Stickler syndrome.
results_summary: The study found that 360° cryotherapy significantly reduced the rate of retinal detachment compared to controls, with no reported major or long-term complications, though the evidence was limited by high risk of bias.
population_specificity: Patients with type 1 Stickler syndrome, specifically those without prior retinal detachment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of 20- and 23-gauge pars plana vitrectomy (PPV) with cryotherapy for managing primary rhegmatogenous retinal detachment (RD) with proliferative vitreoretinopathy (PVR) grade B or less.
results_summary: The study found that 23-gauge PPV with cryotherapy provided similar anatomical and visual outcomes as 20-gauge PPV, with comparable reattachment rates (74.3% vs. 80%) and final anatomical success rates (97% in both groups). Visual acuity improved similarly in both groups, with no significant differences in operative time or intraoperative complications.
population_specificity: Patients with primary rhegmatogenous retinal detachment (RD) and proliferative vitreoretinopathy (PVR) grade B or less, excluding those with previous vitreoretinal surgery, trauma-related RD, or other specified conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) on proprioceptive function, muscle force recovery after eccentric exercise, and tympanic temperature.
results_summary: WBC reduced tympanic temperature by 0.3°C but had no significant effect on joint position sense, muscle force recovery, or muscle soreness after eccentric exercise. The study found no increased risk of proprioceptive-related injury following WBC.
population_specificity: 36 subjects (with a convenience sample of 18 undergoing eccentric exercise).
study_duration: Immediate and 15-minute follow-up measurements; muscle soreness assessed up to 72 hours post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and practicality of cryotherapy as a treatment for pre-invasive cervical cancer in low-resource settings.
results_summary: The study found cryotherapy to be a safe, effective, and low-cost therapy for pre-invasive cervical cancer, recommending its inclusion in treatment protocols for such settings.
population_specificity: Women in low-resource countries with pre-invasive cervical cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in preventing or reducing the severity of oral mucositis in cancer patients undergoing treatment.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was among the ten interventions showing statistically significant, albeit sometimes weak, benefits in preventing or reducing the severity of mucositis compared to placebo or no treatment. The evidence strength varied, suggesting benefits may be specific to certain cancer types and treatments.
population_specificity: Patients receiving treatment for cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the short-term efficacy and complications of using CO₂ in endoscopic cryoablation for treating Barrett's esophagus.
results_summary: Cryotherapy achieved complete histological reversal (CR-IM) in 90.9% of patients, with no severe complications reported. Recurrence occurred in 13.6% of patients at 6 months.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with Barrett's esophagus.
effective_dosage: Monthly stepwise cryoablation with pressurized CO₂ gas (median of 2 sessions per patient, range 1–3).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the latest oncologic and functional outcomes, as well as complications, of salvage cryotherapy for radiation-recurrent prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that salvage cryoablation technology and techniques have significantly improved, making it an established therapeutic option with better oncologic outcomes and reduced complication rates compared to past decades.
population_specificity: Patients with radiation-recurrent prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the characteristics of patients developing premalignant and malignant skin lesions during sorafenib therapy and discuss implications for treatment, including the use of cryotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used to manage cutaneous lesions (e.g., SCCs, verrucas) in patients on sorafenib, with treatment typically involving lesion removal and brief discontinuation of sorafenib. The study noted that cryotherapy was part of the management strategy but did not provide detailed efficacy metrics.
population_specificity: Caucasian men older than 40 years without prior skin cancer history, undergoing sorafenib therapy for malignancies (e.g., metastatic lung adenocarcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review minimally invasive ablative therapies, including cryotherapy, for treating benign and malignant breast tumors in select patient populations.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that cryotherapy and other techniques offer advantages like outpatient setting, reduced pain, and improved cosmesis, but no specific results for cryotherapy are detailed.
population_specificity: Select patient populations with benign or malignant breast tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryotherapy in eradicating neoplastic Barrett's esophagus as part of a review of endoscopic ablation technologies.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that cryotherapy is among the effective endoscopic ablation technologies for treating neoplastic Barrett's esophagus, though specific efficacy data for cryotherapy alone are not detailed. The review suggests that these technologies, including cryotherapy, can make esophagectomy avoidable in certain patients.
population_specificity: Patients with dysplasia and superficial neoplasia in Barrett's esophagus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare recurrence rates of different treatment modalities for pyogenic granuloma, including cryotherapy, to determine the most effective management options.
results_summary: Cryotherapy demonstrated the lowest recurrence rate (1.62%) among medical treatments for pyogenic granuloma, making it a highly effective non-surgical option. The study found no statistical difference in recurrence rates between surgical excision and cryotherapy (p-value 0.426).
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous pyogenic granuloma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy using ice in a plastic bag effectively reduces wound pain severity after arthroscopy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced pain scores in postarthroscopy patients (from 5.12 to 1.82 in the experimental group vs. 4.04 to 2.88 in controls), with statistically significant improvements (p-values: 0.047, 0.012, 0.005). The study concluded that ice packing is a simple, cost-effective method for pain relief.
population_specificity: 59 patients who underwent arthroscopy (33 in the experimental group, 26 controls).
effective_dosage: Three 10-minute ice packing sessions over three hours, with 50-minute intervals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of oral cryotherapy in preventing oral mucositis (OM) in patients undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT) with specific conditioning regimens.
results_summary: The study found that oral cryotherapy significantly reduced OM incidence, with 18% OM in cryotherapy vs. 68% without it in the high-dose melphalan regimen and 38% vs. 86% in the BEAM regimen. Non-provision of cryotherapy was the most significant predictor of OM.
population_specificity: 126 patients undergoing autologous HSCT with BEAM or high-dose melphalan (200mg/m²) conditioning regimens.
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy application details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize clinical and research studies on photodynamic therapy for Bowen's disease, comparing its efficacy to other treatments like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results for cryotherapy, focusing instead on photodynamic therapy's efficacy with methyl aminolevulinate and light-emitting diodes.
population_specificity: Patients with Bowen's disease (squamous cell carcinoma in situ).

study_goal: To determine the tolerability and response to cryotherapy in patients with chronic hemorrhagic radiation proctitis (CRP).
results_summary: Cryoablation improved both endoscopic severity (rectal telangiectasia density decreased from 2.7 to 1.7) and subjective clinical scores (RPSAS improved from 27.7 to 13.6), with statistically significant results (P=.004 and P=.003, respectively). Endoscopic improvement correlated with symptom improvement.
population_specificity: Ten patients with chronic hemorrhagic radiation proctitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of continuous cold flow therapy on blood loss, pain, swelling, and range of motion in patients undergoing total knee replacement compared to other methods like ice bags or narcotics.
results_summary: Six studies showed significantly lower pain scores with cold compression compared to controls, while most studies noted reduced swelling and blood loss but no difference in range of motion. Cryotherapy may provide benefits despite not being statistically highly effective.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing total knee replacement.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of cryotherapy (cold water immersion) on knee joint position sense in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in knee joint position sense between cold and tepid water immersion, with modest effect sizes and confidence intervals crossing zero, indicating no enhanced injury risk post-cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Fourteen healthy volunteers with no prior knee injury or clinical conditions.
effective_dosage: 30-minute immersion in cold (14 ± 1 °C) or tepid (28 ± 1 °C) water.
study_duration: Single 30-minute session per condition, with a one-week washout period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the status of cryotherapy and HIFU as emerging therapies for low-risk prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: Small-scale studies showed favorable outcomes for cryotherapy in low-risk prostate cancer, but complications like urinary incontinence and impotence were reported. Further research is needed to establish these therapies as viable alternatives.
population_specificity: Patients with low-risk prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of imiquimod 3.75% with other treatments, including cryotherapy, for actinic keratosis of the face and balding scalp.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy followed by imiquimod 3.75% had an additive effect, suggesting improved efficacy. Cryotherapy's standalone efficacy was not directly compared, but it was noted as a viable treatment option among others.
population_specificity: Patients with actinic keratosis of the face and balding scalp.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy among various treatment modalities for keloids and hypertrophic scars (HTS).
results_summary: Cryotherapy is mentioned as one of several commonly used treatments for keloids and HTS, though no single modality is completely effective. The abstract notes that cryosurgery may require additional training, implying it is a specialized procedure with potential risks.
population_specificity: Patients with keloids and hypertrophic scars (HTS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy for treating cutaneous warts compared to placebo and other treatments, using intention-to-treat principles.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was not statistically better than placebo (RR 0.89), but aggressive cryotherapy was significantly more effective than gentle cryotherapy (RR 2.06). Combined therapy of cryotherapy and salicylic acid had a higher cure rate than either treatment alone.
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the costs of visual inspection with acetic acid (VIA) and cryotherapy for cervical cancer screening in Ghana and explore determinants of these costs.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy costs ranged from $47.26 to $84.48 per woman at surveyed facilities, with modeled estimates at $27.96 under base case assumptions. Sensitivity analysis identified the number of women screened and treated as key cost determinants.
population_specificity: Women undergoing cervical cancer screening in Ghana.

study_goal: The study aimed to compare the efficacy of daylight-mediated methyl aminolaevulinate (MAL)-PDT with different daylight exposure durations, not Cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study did not evaluate Cryotherapy; it focused on daylight-mediated MAL-PDT for actinic keratoses, finding it effective and nearly pain-free.
population_specificity: 120 patients with 1572 thin actinic keratoses of the face and scalp.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in preventing or reducing the severity of oral mucositis in cancer patients undergoing treatment.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy showed statistically significant evidence of benefit in preventing or reducing the severity of oral mucositis compared to placebo or no treatment, though the strength of the evidence was variable.
population_specificity: Patients receiving treatment for cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the reattachment rate and visual acuity outcomes in patients with rhegmatogenous retinal detachment treated with intraoperative cryotherapy versus postoperative laser photocoagulation during scleral buckle surgery.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed similar anatomical success rates (93% at 1 week, 100% at 1 and 6 months) to laserpexy, though visual recovery was slower. Both techniques had comparable postoperative complications, except for higher eyelid edema in the cryotherapy group.
population_specificity: Patients with rhegmatogenous retinal detachment scheduled for scleral buckle surgery (n=86).
study_duration: Follow-up at 1 week, 1 month, and 6 months post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of cryotherapy, alone or combined with antimony injections, for treating cutaneous leishmaniasis in military personnel.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with antimony injections showed satisfactory treatment outcomes, with 77.1% of patients cured at six months; however, 19.5% required secondary treatment with miltefosine. Natural evolution also contributed to cure rates.
population_specificity: Dutch military troops deployed in northern Afghanistan affected by cutaneous leishmaniasis caused by Leishmania major.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as an endoscopic therapeutic modality for treating neoplasia in Barrett's esophagus (BE).
results_summary: The abstract highlights cryotherapy as one of the effective modalities for ablating or removing Barrett's epithelium to address synchronous and metachronous lesions, alongside other endoscopic treatments. However, specific outcomes or comparative efficacy of cryotherapy are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with Barrett's esophagus (BE) and associated neoplasia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of cryotherapy, particularly using liquid nitrogen and carbon dioxide, for treating dysplastic Barrett's esophagus.
results_summary: Preliminary data indicated high efficacy in reversing dysplastic Barrett mucosa and an excellent safety profile for cryotherapy using liquid nitrogen and carbon dioxide. Ongoing investigations suggest continued interest in this treatment method.
population_specificity: Patients with dysplastic Barrett's esophagus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review nonsurgical methods of scar revision, including cryotherapy, among other treatments.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several nonsurgical methods for scar revision but does not provide specific findings about its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of scar management)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the safety and efficacy of cryotherapy as a depigmenting therapy for vitiligo universalis compared to other available agents/techniques.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is identified as a cheap depigmenting therapy but carries a risk of scarring, limiting its use to experienced dermatologists. No comparative trials were found to assess its efficacy relative to other depigmentation methods.
population_specificity: Patients with vitiligo universalis (widespread depigmentation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of focal cryotherapy as a minimally invasive treatment for localized prostate cancer, focusing on reducing complications while maintaining effectiveness.
results_summary: Focal cryotherapy shows promising efficacy with low morbidity rates in treating prostate cancer, though complications like incontinence and erectile dysfunction still occur. Long-term follow-up is needed for definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBCT) on oxidative stress markers in depressive versus non-depressive multiple sclerosis (MS) patients.
results_summary: WBCT significantly increased total antioxidative status (TAS) in depressive MS patients more than in non-depressive patients, but it had no effect on superoxide dismutase (SOD) or catalase (CAT) activities. The study concluded that WBCT suppresses oxidative stress in MS patients, particularly in depressive individuals.
population_specificity: 22 MS patients with secondary progressive disease (12 depressive, 10 non-depressive).
effective_dosage: 10 exposures in a cryochamber (specific duration per session not stated).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated, but implied to be short-term (10 sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the clinical effectiveness of combining nitric oxide cream with cryotherapy for treating old world cutaneous leishmaniasis compared to cryotherapy alone.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in effectiveness between the combination of nitric oxide and cryotherapy versus cryotherapy with placebo, with 83.3% of the treatment group and 74.1% of the control group showing complete improvement. Adverse effects like erythema and irritation were more common in the treatment group but not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 63 Iranian patients with cutaneous leishmaniasis in southern Iran.
effective_dosage: 3% nitric oxide cream applied topically alongside once-weekly cryotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy among various treatments for managing different types of acne scars.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several resurfacing methods for acne scar management but does not provide specific results for cryotherapy alone. Combining treatments may offer better improvement than single methods, but no treatment achieves complete scar resolution.
population_specificity: Individuals with acne scarring, including hypertrophic (keloid) and atrophic (icepick, rolling, boxcar) scars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of focal therapy, including cryotherapy, as a treatment option for low-risk prostate cancer patients by targeting cancerous lesions while minimizing damage to surrounding healthy tissue.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that focal therapy, including cryotherapy, could offer long-term cancer control with minimal morbidity compared to radical therapy, but acknowledges the lack of robust evidence supporting this approach. High-quality imaging is emphasized as crucial for accurate targeting, monitoring, and follow-up.
population_specificity: Low-risk, carefully selected prostate cancer patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the impact of combined cryotherapy and compression (Cryo/Cuff) versus standard care on pain, swelling, range of motion, and subjective impairment in patients undergoing wrist arthroscopy.
results_summary: The study found that Cryo/Cuff resulted in a 49% reduction in pain compared to 41% in the control group, but no significant differences were observed in swelling, range of motion, or DASH scores between the two groups. The conclusion was that additional cryotherapy and compression did not significantly improve outcomes over standard care.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing wrist arthroscopy (52 analyzed out of 56 initially assessed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate focal therapy, including cryotherapy, as an alternative to active surveillance or radical treatment for low-risk prostate cancer, focusing on long-term cancer control with minimal morbidity.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that focal therapy, including cryotherapy, shows promise for cancer control with minimal morbidity, but more large-scale trials with longer follow-up are needed to confirm safety, efficacy, and the absence of viable cells post-ablation.
population_specificity: Men with low-risk prostate cancer

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of high-risk HPV testing (using self-collected and clinician-collected samples) and cervical cytology in detecting post-treatment failures (CIN2+) after cryotherapy in a screen-and-treat cervical cancer prevention program.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was not 100% effective, with 33 cases of CIN2+ detected among treated women. HPV testing using clinician-collected samples detected the most cases (85% in treated women, 91% in untreated), while self-collected samples performed poorly for detecting post-treatment failures (55% sensitivity in treated women vs. 78% in untreated).
population_specificity: Women in a South African screen-and-treat trial, including those who underwent cryotherapy (n=812) and those who did not (n=1858).
study_duration: Follow-up at 6 and 12 months after enrollment (and after cryotherapy, if performed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term efficacy of two screen-and-treat approaches (HPV DNA testing and visual inspection) using cryotherapy for cervical cancer prevention in low-resource settings.
results_summary: The HPV-and-treat approach showed a sustained reduction in CIN2+ cases (1.5% vs. 5.6% in controls) and fewer incident cases (0.3%) compared to visual inspection-and-treat (1.3%) and control arms (1.0%). The visual inspection-and-treat approach also reduced CIN2+ but was less effective than HPV testing.
population_specificity: 6,637 unscreened South African women aged 35-65 years, including HIV-positive individuals.
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy applied as standard treatment for positive test results).
study_duration: Follow-up extended to 36 months, with initial treatment at enrollment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the management of urorectal fistulae (URF) resulting from prostate cancer treatments, including salvage cryotherapy, and to distinguish between post-surgical and post-irradiation fistulae.
results_summary: The study found that urorectal fistulae (URF) could be managed effectively without transanorectal sphincter-splitting approaches or colostomies, except in complex cases like those with cavitation or post-irradiation URF, which required interposition flaps. Salvage cryotherapy was among the treatments associated with complex URF, particularly when combined with other energy-based therapies.
population_specificity: 40 patients with urorectal fistulae (URF) after prostate cancer treatment (23 post-surgical, 17 post-irradiation, including salvage cryotherapy cases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy, salicylic acid application, and a wait-and-see approach for treating cutaneous warts in primary care.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed higher cure rates (39%) compared to salicylic acid (24%) and wait-and-see (16%) at 13 weeks, particularly for common warts (49% vs. 15% vs. 8%). No significant difference was found for plantar warts.
population_specificity: Patients aged 4 to 79 years with new cutaneous warts in primary care settings in the Netherlands.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy with liquid nitrogen every two weeks.
study_duration: 13 weeks (primary outcome), with follow-up at 4, 13, and 26 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of surgical interventions, including cryotherapy, for treating keratocystic odontogenic tumours (KCOTs).
results_summary: No randomised controlled trials meeting the inclusion criteria were identified, so no conclusions could be drawn about the effectiveness of cryotherapy or other interventions for KCOTs.
population_specificity: Adults over 18 with a validated diagnosis of solitary KCOTs in the jaw bones (maxilla or mandible), excluding those with Gorlin syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the 5-year recurrence rate of primary periocular basal cell carcinomas treated with nitrous oxide probe cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found an 8% recurrence rate at 5-year follow-up, with no significant correlation between tumor site, size, or freeze time and recurrence. Cryotherapy demonstrated advantages over surgical removal for tumors up to 8 mm in the periocular region.
population_specificity: Patients with clinically well-defined primary periocular basal cell carcinomas (maximum diameter of 8 mm).
effective_dosage: Double freeze-thaw cycle nitrous oxide contact cryotherapy (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize different treatment options for localized prostate cancer, including cryotherapy, and their associated side-effects and impacts on quality of life.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy but highlights the lack of high-level evidence and randomized trials comparing treatment options, complicating the assessment of optimal interventions.
population_specificity: Patients with early stage, clinically localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effects of HVPC combined with conventional treatment (including cryotherapy) on pain, edema, range of motion, and gait in individuals with lateral ankle sprains.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences between groups, but the HVPC(-) group showed greater reductions in volume and girth, improved ROM and gait velocity, and faster recovery time compared to other groups. Cryotherapy was part of the conventional treatment but its isolated effects were not specifically highlighted.
population_specificity: 28 participants with lateral ankle sprains (2 to 96 hours post-trauma).
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy was administered for 20 minutes per session.
study_duration: Treatment duration ranged from 1.2 to 2.6 weeks, depending on the group.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a screen-and-treat strategy using cryotherapy for cervical intraepithelial neoplasia in HIV-positive women.
results_summary: Screen-and-treat with human papillomavirus DNA testing significantly reduced cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade 2 or higher in both HIV-positive and HIV-negative women, with cryotherapy complications being mostly minor and similar in frequency between groups.
population_specificity: HIV-positive and HIV-negative women in Cape Town, South Africa.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of liquid nitrogen cryotherapy (LN) for treating Leishmania donovani cutaneous leishmaniasis in type V skin.
results_summary: LN achieved a 91.7% cure rate within one to seven sessions, with better outcomes for smaller lesions (≤1 cm) and those on the head or upper limbs. Adverse effects included temporary pain, ulceration (33%), depigmentation (46.9%), and scarring (43%), with one recurrence (1.6%) during follow-up.
population_specificity: 65 patients (121 lesions) with Leishmania donovani cutaneous leishmaniasis and type V skin.
effective_dosage: 15-20 seconds per cryosession, two sessions per site, weekly for 1-3 weeks, fortnightly for 4-5 weeks, then monthly until cure.
study_duration: Treatment duration varied (1-7 sessions), with 6 months of follow-up post-cure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a non-surgical alternative for treating Barrett's esophagus with high-grade dysplasia or intramucosal carcinoma.
results_summary: The study suggests that cryotherapy, along with other endoscopic therapies, is an acceptable non-surgical option for treating Barrett's esophagus with high-grade dysplasia or intramucosal carcinoma, aiming to ablate all Barrett's epithelium to prevent synchronous/metachronous lesions.
population_specificity: Patients with Barrett's esophagus exhibiting high-grade dysplasia or intramucosal carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the role of hand therapy, including cryotherapy, in managing upper extremity disorders.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several modalities used in hand therapy for managing pain, edema, and other aspects of upper extremity injuries, but no specific results or outcomes for cryotherapy are detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with upper extremity injuries receiving hand therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the current state of knowledge regarding subtotal prostate ablative strategies, focusing on oncologic and quality-of-life outcomes.
results_summary: The study found limited published data on oncologic or quality-of-life outcomes for subtotal prostate cryoablation, with only a few small clinical trials and one retrospective review available. Current strategies vary widely in eligibility criteria and tissue targeting, lacking sufficient evidence to justify the growing popularity of these approaches.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer undergoing subtotal prostate ablation (cryoablation or HIFU).

study_goal: To determine if oral cryotherapy during myeloablative therapy reduces mucositis severity, improves nutritional status, and lowers infection rates in bone marrow transplant patients.
results_summary: Oral cryotherapy significantly reduced mucositis severity (grades 3-4), decreased hospital days, lowered the need for total parenteral nutrition, and improved nutritional status (albumin levels), but did not significantly affect infection rates.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing myeloablative therapy before bone marrow transplantation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy with photodynamic therapy (PDT) in treating Bowen's disease and basal cell carcinoma (BCC).
results_summary: For Bowen's disease, PDT showed better outcomes compared to cryotherapy or fluorouracil. For BCC, PDT resulted in similar lesion response rates to cryotherapy but with better cosmetic outcomes.
population_specificity: People with pre-cancerous skin conditions (actinic keratosis, Bowen's disease) or primary skin cancer (basal cell carcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the outcomes of cryotherapy with other treatment strategies for small incidental renal cortical tumours, focusing on oncological and clinical benefits.
results_summary: The abstract mentions emergent short-term oncological and clinical outcomes for cryotherapy, suggesting it as a viable alternative to more invasive treatments like radical nephrectomy, but does not provide specific efficacy data. Recent studies highlight partial nephrectomy's benefits for minimizing chronic kidney disease risk, implying cryotherapy may have comparable or favorable outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with small incidental renal cortical tumours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of CO(2) laser therapy versus combined cryotherapy and intralesional meglumine antimoniate for treating dry-type cutaneous leishmaniasis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with intralesional meglumine antimoniate achieved a 78% complete cure rate, lower than CO(2) laser's 93.7%. Complications were similar in both groups and limited to ulcer sites.
population_specificity: Patients with dry-type cutaneous leishmaniasis in Kerman, Iran.
effective_dosage: Biweekly cryotherapy and weekly intralesional meglumine antimoniate.
study_duration: Up to 12 weeks or until complete cure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of cryotherapy (contrast baths and ice baths) for recovery in rugby players compared to passive recovery.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in performance tests (300-m and phosphate decrement tests) between recovery methods, but effect sizes suggested contrast baths had medium to large benefits over control, while ice baths showed trivial or negative effects. Subjective reports indicated a trend favoring contrast baths for recovery.
population_specificity: 26 players from a premier rugby club.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the histological changes caused by cryotherapy in liver tumors to understand the basis for local recurrences.
results_summary: Cryotherapy produces a lesion with central coagulative necrosis and a surrounding inflammatory zone, influenced by factors like probe temperature and freezing cycles. The temporal evolution involves inflammatory invasion and fibrotic substitution, similar to other ablation techniques, but optimal parameters and effects on local recurrences remain unclear.
population_specificity: Liver tumors (clinical and in-vivo animal studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Cryotherapy as a definitive treatment for trichiasis, focusing on its effectiveness and potential complications.
results_summary: The abstract mentions Cryotherapy as one of the definitive treatments for trichiasis, but does not provide specific outcomes or comparative efficacy data. It notes that surgical treatments have poor long-term results and frequent recurrences, implying Cryotherapy may offer a more durable solution.
population_specificity: Patients with trichiasis, often associated with cicatricial entropion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and tolerability of cryotherapy combined with intralesional steroid treatment versus surgical excision plus radiotherapy for keloid treatment.
results_summary: Cryotherapy with intralesional steroids showed more side effects, a prolonged treatment course, higher recurrence rates, and less patient satisfaction compared to surgery plus irradiation, though it remained effective for small or newly formed keloids.
population_specificity: 26 patients with 76 keloids (9 patients with 32 keloids in the cryotherapy group).
effective_dosage: Multiple sessions until lesion flattening (mean 5.84 ± 2.51 sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy compared to other surgical treatments for cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN).
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in treatment failures (persistent disease) between cryotherapy and other surgical techniques. Cryotherapy was not highlighted as superior or inferior in terms of operative morbidity, but data on morbidity comparisons were limited.
population_specificity: Women with cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of adjuvant cryotherapy in managing conjunctival melanoma, particularly its impact on recurrence and metastatic spread.
results_summary: The study found that early complete excision with adjuvant cryotherapy and topical chemotherapy may be curative in some patients, though conjunctival melanoma has high recurrence and metastatic rates. Cryotherapy's effectiveness is noted, but its impact is limited by the disease's aggressive nature.
population_specificity: Patients with conjunctival melanoma, particularly those with lesions greater than 2 mm in thickness and arising from nonbulbar conjunctiva.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cervical cryotherapy reduces newly detected high-risk human papillomavirus (hrHPV) infections in HIV-positive and HIV-negative women who were initially hrHPV negative.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced newly detected hrHPV infections in HIV-negative women (55% less likely) but showed no significant reduction in HIV-positive women. The effect was independent of changes in sexual behavior.
population_specificity: HIV-positive and HIV-negative women aged 35 to 65 years, initially hrHPV negative.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the effectiveness of cryotherapy compared to other treatments, including surgery, for refractory cases of angiolymphoid hyperplasia with eosinophilia (ALHE).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, along with other conventional therapies, had limited success in treating ALHE, with recurrences being common. Surgery was ultimately more effective for refractory cases.
population_specificity: A patient with refractory ALHE (a rare benign disease characterized by red to brown papules or nodules, primarily in the head and neck region).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, physiological effects, and potential benefits of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) for athletes and individuals with rheumatic conditions.
results_summary: WBC was found to be safe with no significant adverse effects, showing anti-inflammatory benefits, stabilization of lysosomal membranes, and positive effects on muscle recovery enzymes. It did not negatively impact cardiac markers or the immunological system, though it induced mild oxidative stress and adaptive changes in antioxidant status.
population_specificity: Athletes and individuals with rheumatic conditions (e.g., arthritis, fibromyalgia, ankylosing spondylitis).
effective_dosage: Exposure to -110°C to -140°C air for 2 minutes per session.
study_duration: Not specified (repeated treatments mentioned but no exact duration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the status of regional therapies, including cryotherapy, for treating colorectal cancer liver metastases, focusing on their role compared to systemic chemotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several locoregional therapies for unresectable liver metastases but does not provide specific findings on its effectiveness. It highlights that systemic chemotherapy is more appropriate for metastatic spread beyond the liver.
population_specificity: Patients with colorectal cancer liver metastases, particularly those with unresectable but isolated liver tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the oncologic efficacy and complication profiles of cryotherapy as a minimally invasive treatment for small renal masses (SRMs).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy has favorable initial oncologic efficacy and complication profiles, but challenges remain due to suboptimal outcome definitions, lack of prospective and randomized data, and short follow-up periods relative to the natural history of SRMs.
population_specificity: Patients with small renal masses (SRMs) and renal-cell carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy combined with surgical excision and adjuvant topical mitomycin C (MMC) in treating non-invasive ocular surface squamous neoplasia (CCIN).
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with surgical excision and MMC showed no recurrences in localized primary CCIN cases, but diffuse primary cases had a 30% recurrence rate. Recurrent localized cases had a 12.5% recurrence rate, with the only recurrence occurring in a diffuse-type case.
population_specificity: 90 patients with 91 primary or recurrent CCIN lesions treated at a single ocular oncology center.
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy (adjuvant MMC dosage: 0.04% four times a day).
study_duration: Follow-up ranged from 5.8 to 119.8 months (mean 56.8 months).

study_goal: The abstract does not specifically address the researchers' goals regarding Cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions Cryotherapy as an initial therapy for prostate cancer but does not provide specific findings about its effects.
population_specificity: Men with prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent advances in percutaneous cryoablation (PCA) and percutaneous radiofrequency ablation (RFA) for small renal cortical neoplasms, focusing on patient selection and outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that PCA and RFA offer excellent patient recovery, lower complication rates, and promising oncologic outcomes, expanding their use to a larger patient population beyond highly selected cases. Collaborative approaches between urologists and interventional radiologists were noted to optimize ablation success.
population_specificity: Patients with small (<or=4 cm) renal cortical neoplasms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of cryotherapy on joint position sense (JPS) and determine safe return-to-participation timelines for healthy athletes.
results_summary: The study found limited and equivocal evidence on cryotherapy's effect on proprioception, with modest effect sizes (ranging from -0.08 to 1.17) indicating increased JPS error post-treatment. Clinicians are advised to be cautious when returning individuals to proprioceptive tasks immediately after cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Healthy human participants (athletes) with assessments focused on ankle, knee, and shoulder joints.
study_duration: Immediate post-cryotherapy assessment (no long-term intervention duration mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the applicability and short-term outcomes of focal cryotherapy for localized low-risk prostate cancer, focusing on patient selection and follow-up strategies.
results_summary: The study found that focal cryotherapy demonstrates excellent short-term results and a favorable quality-of-life profile, though more data and consensus are needed for broader clinical adoption.
population_specificity: Men with localized low-risk prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of two types of external compression (elastic wrap and Flex-i-Wrap) on surface and intramuscular cooling during cryotherapy using an ice bag.
results_summary: Elastic wrap produced greater surface and intramuscular temperature reductions compared to no compression and Flex-i-Wrap, with differences persisting throughout the protocol. Flex-i-Wrap also outperformed no compression in intramuscular cooling but was less effective than elastic wrap.
population_specificity: Fourteen college students (10 women, 4 men) with prior cryotherapy experience and a posterior lower leg skinfold ≤15 mm.
effective_dosage: Ice bag applied for 30 minutes per session.
study_duration: 30 minutes per session, with follow-up measurements for 95 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of endoscopic spray cryotherapy for treating esophageal carcinoma in patients ineligible for conventional therapies.
results_summary: Cryotherapy achieved complete eradication of intraluminal cancer in 61.2% of treated subjects, with higher efficacy (75%) in mucosal cancer cases. No serious adverse events were reported, though benign strictures developed in 13% of subjects, mostly those with prior treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with esophageal carcinoma who were ineligible for, refused, or failed conventional therapies (median age 76, 81% male, 94% adenocarcinoma).
study_duration: Treatment duration varied until tumor eradication or discontinuation due to progression, preference, or comorbidities. Mean follow-up was 10.6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of endoscopic spray cryotherapy (CRYO) in treating Barrett's esophagus (BE) with high-grade dysplasia (HGD).
results_summary: CRYO was found to be safe with minimal adverse events (e.g., strictures in 3 subjects, severe chest pain in 2). It was highly effective, with 97% of subjects achieving complete eradication of HGD, 87% eradicating all dysplasia, and 57% eliminating all intestinal metaplasia.
population_specificity: Subjects with BE and HGD confirmed by two pathologists (mean age 65.4 years, 83% male, mean BE length 5.3 cm).
effective_dosage: Mean of 3.4 treatments per subject (total 333 treatments).
study_duration: Treatment period from 2007 to 2009, with a mean follow-up of 10.5 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety of cryotherapy and LEEP for cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN) in low- and middle-income countries, focusing on potential harms and benefits.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy and LEEP in resource-limited settings were not associated with excess harm, with short-term safety profiles similar to those in high-income countries. However, data on HIV-related harms and long-term reproductive outcomes were insufficient.
population_specificity: Women in low- and middle-income countries, primarily in Asia and Africa, treated for cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the health-related quality of life impact and recovery profiles of cryotherapy against other treatments for localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed higher urinary function and bother scores compared to open and robotic prostatectomy, with a 3-fold higher rate of return to baseline urinary function. However, it had lower sexual function and bother scores compared to brachytherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer treated between February 2000 and December 2008.
study_duration: Follow-up assessments up to 36 months post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide an overview of treatment options for non-melanoma skin cancers, including cryotherapy, and to position photodynamic therapy (PDT) among these options.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as an established treatment for non-melanoma skin cancers but does not provide specific results regarding its efficacy compared to other treatments. The focus is on PDT as a standard treatment modality.
population_specificity: Fair-skinned individuals with non-melanoma skin cancers (actinic keratosis, Bowen's disease, basal cell carcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and mid-term outcomes of using an 8-mm tip Cryoablation catheter for treating AVNRT in pediatric patients.
results_summary: Initial procedural success was achieved in 91% of patients, with transient AV block in 6.5% and no permanent AV block. Recurrence rate was low (2.8%) over an 11.6-month follow-up.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (mean age 14.8 years, weight 62.0 kg) with normal cardiac anatomy and AVNRT.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of menthol-counterirritant application, sham counterirritant, and no intervention on quadriceps motoneuron-pool excitability (MNPE) in healthy subjects.
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of menthol on quadriceps MNPE, as Hmax:Mmax ratios decreased similarly across all groups over time, with no group differences or interaction effects.
population_specificity: Thirty healthy subjects (16 male, 14 female; mean age 24.1 ± 3.9 years) with no history of lower extremity surgery.
effective_dosage: 2 mL of menthol or sham counterirritant applied to the anterior knee.
study_duration: Measurements were taken at 5, 15, 25, and 35 minutes post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and comparative outcomes of cryotherapy as a treatment for prostate cancer, particularly in comparison to radiation therapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy demonstrated favorable biochemical outcomes, with 5-year disease-free survival rates of 91% (low-risk), 78% (intermediate-risk), and 62% (high-risk). It also showed a high rate of negative post-treatment biopsies (87-98%) and lower complication rates (e.g., <5% incontinence, 0.5% rectal fistula) compared to radiation therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer (low, intermediate, and high-risk groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current state of cryoablation as a treatment for organ-confined prostate cancer, including its role in focal ablation.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that cryoablation is recognized as an established treatment for organ-confined prostate cancer and may have a role in focal ablation in select cases. Emerging data support its use in these applications.
population_specificity: Men with newly diagnosed or radiorecurrent organ-confined prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate focal therapy, including cryotherapy, as a middle-ground treatment for prostate cancer, balancing efficacy with reduced toxicity compared to radical therapies.
results_summary: Early feasibility studies showed cryotherapy preserved genitourinary function in 80-90% of men and had no reported rectal toxicity, suggesting it may reduce treatment burden compared to radical therapies.
population_specificity: Men with low- to intermediate-risk prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of liquid nitrogen cryotherapy in treating Elastosis perforans serpiginosa (EPS).
results_summary: The study found that liquid nitrogen cryotherapy was successful in treating EPS, with the treatment being well-tolerated and having few side effects.
population_specificity: A 13-year-old male with a 1-year history of facial EPS lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of cryotherapy using liquid nitrogen versus salicylic acid for treating verrucae.
results_summary: The study assessed complete clearance of verrucae at 12 weeks and secondary outcomes like time to clearance, recurrence at 6 months, and patient satisfaction, but specific results for cryotherapy are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients aged 12 years and over with verrucae.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy delivered by a healthcare professional for a maximum of 4 treatments, 2-3 weeks apart.
study_duration: Up to 12 weeks (with follow-up at 6 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an evidence-based rehabilitation protocol post-ACL reconstruction, evaluating cryotherapy among other modalities for pain, swelling, and inflammation reduction.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, as part of an accelerated rehabilitation protocol, effectively reduced pain, swelling, and inflammation without stability issues, contributing to faster recovery.
population_specificity: Athletes post-ACL reconstruction with BPTB or ST/G grafts.

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the effectiveness of intralesional pingyangmycin injection for resistant plantar warts, not Cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that intralesional pingyangmycin injection cleared lesions in 87.88% of patients and achieved partial clearance in the remaining 12.12%, with no serious side effects reported. The abstract does not report results for Cryotherapy.
population_specificity: 66 patients with plantar warts.
study_duration: Up to 4 treatments (specific duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy in treating basal cell carcinoma, focusing on treatment response/recurrence within 1 year and long-term recurrence (minimum 2 years post-treatment).
results_summary: The study included cryotherapy among interventions for basal cell carcinoma, but specific efficacy or safety results for cryotherapy alone were not detailed in the abstract. The overall review found varying levels of evidence for different treatments.
population_specificity: People with basal cell carcinoma, predominantly affecting the head and neck, with increased incidence after age 40 and rising in younger populations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy as a treatment for external genital warts (EGWs) caused by HPV.
results_summary: The study found cryotherapy to be an effective intervention for treating EGWs, as part of a broader review of multiple treatments. Specific outcomes for cryotherapy were not detailed in the abstract, but it was included among treatments with evaluated effectiveness.
population_specificity: Sexually active women and men with external genital warts (EGWs) caused by HPV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy among other interventions for preventing progression from retinal breaks or lattice degeneration to retinal detachment and treating rhegmatogenous retinal detachment.
results_summary: The study included cryotherapy as one of several interventions but did not provide specific results for cryotherapy alone. The overall findings suggested that various surgical and pharmacological interventions, including cryotherapy, were evaluated for their effectiveness in managing retinal detachment and related complications.
population_specificity: Individuals with rhegmatogenous retinal detachment, retinal breaks, or lattice degeneration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy or argon laser treatment at inner sclerostomy sites during vitrectomy for proliferative diabetic retinopathy reduces late recurrent postoperative vitreous cavity hemorrhage.
results_summary: The study found a significant reduction in late recurrent vitreous cavity hemorrhage in the treatment group (6%) compared to the control group (15%). Fewer eyes in the treatment group required revision surgery, though this difference was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing vitrectomy for proliferative diabetic retinopathy.
study_duration: Follow-up within the first 6 months post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of endoscopic spray cryotherapy for treating dysplasia in Barrett esophagus and esophageal carcinoma.
results_summary: Spray cryotherapy showed comparable success in eradicating Barrett high-grade dysplasia to other therapies, with a favorable safety profile and high patient comfort. It also offered therapeutic potential for early-stage esophageal cancer and palliation in advanced cases.
population_specificity: Patients with Barrett esophagus-associated dysplasia and esophageal carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a pretreatment nomogram to predict biochemical failure after salvage cryotherapy for locally recurrent prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found a 66% biochemical failure rate after salvage cryotherapy with a median follow-up of 3.4 years. A nomogram was developed using serum PSA level, initial clinical T stage, and biopsy Gleason score to predict outcomes.
population_specificity: 797 men with locally recurrent prostate cancer after primary radiotherapy, treated at six tertiary-care referral centers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the detection and treatment of local recurrences after prostate cancer therapies, including cryotherapy, and assess the role of imaging in improving salvage therapy outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that local recurrences after cryotherapy can be treated with a second session or radiotherapy, and MRI is effective in detecting recurrences regardless of initial treatment. Dynamic contrast-enhanced MRI was noted as particularly accurate for detection.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer experiencing biochemical failure after initial treatments (e.g., radical prostatectomy, radiotherapy, cryotherapy, HIFU ablation, or brachytherapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy, safety, and acceptability of cryotherapy versus imiquimod 5% cream for treating molluscum contagiosum in children.
results_summary: Cryotherapy achieved a 100% complete cure rate, with 70.27% of patients clearing after 3 weeks and the remaining 29.72% by 6 weeks. However, it was associated with more adverse effects like pain, bullae formation, pigmentary changes, and superficial scarring compared to imiquimod.
population_specificity: 74 children with molluscum contagiosum.
study_duration: Up to 16 weeks or until clinical cure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate minimally invasive treatment options, including cryotherapy, for small renal masses (SRMs) as alternatives to nephron-sparing surgery.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy is an option for carefully selected tumors, with emerging data suggesting it may offer reduced patient morbidity compared to open partial nephrectomy (OPN). However, long-term oncologic and functional outcomes were not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with small renal masses (SRMs), particularly those not amenable to nephron-sparing surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy at sclerotomy sites could prevent late post-vitrectomy diabetic hemorrhage.
results_summary: Cryotherapy increased the risk of late vitreous hemorrhage (28.6% in cases vs. 10.9% in controls) and showed no preventive benefit. No significant differences in sclerotomy site morphology were found between groups.
population_specificity: 119 patients (124 eyes) with proliferative diabetic retinopathy undergoing pars plana vitrectomy.
effective_dosage: Two cryotherapy spots per sclerotomy site.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review existing evidence on cryoimmunology and explore mechanisms for generating an anti-tumor immune response, as well as potential combinations of cryoablation with immunotherapy for metastatic disease control.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryoablation can induce a systemic anti-tumor immune response, supported by anecdotal clinical reports and animal models, and discusses combining it with immunotherapy to enhance its effects on metastatic disease progression.
population_specificity: Patients with localized or metastatic urologic malignancies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of percutaneous cryoablation for local control of extra-abdominal desmoid tumors in patients who had failed standard therapy.
results_summary: Cryoablation achieved complete tumor coverage and pain relief in small to moderately sized tumors, with long-term resolution in some cases. Larger tumors showed limited effectiveness, with partial pain relief and eventual return of symptoms.
population_specificity: Five patients (three female, two male, aged 9-41 years) with extra-abdominal desmoid tumors unresponsive to standard therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review therapeutic interventions, including cryotherapy, that may help clinicians overcome arthrogenic muscle inhibition (AMI) in knee joint pathologies.
results_summary: The study identified cryotherapy as one of the promising interventions to counter AMI, though it did not provide specific efficacy data for cryotherapy alone. AMI severity varies with joint damage, time since injury, and knee joint angle, and cryotherapy may help mitigate these effects.
population_specificity: Patients with arthritis, knee injury, or post-surgery experiencing arthrogenic muscle inhibition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryotherapy in reducing pain, swelling, and blood loss after total knee arthroplasty (TKA) through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed small benefits in blood loss and early knee range of motion but no lasting benefits in pain, swelling, transfusion requirements, analgesia use, length of stay, or long-term knee range of motion. The evidence does not support routine use of cryotherapy after TKA.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent total knee arthroplasty (TKA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and tolerability of 0.5% and 5% 5-FU cream formulations for treating multiple actinic keratoses (AKs) on the face and scalp.
results_summary: The study found that 5% 5-FU showed higher complete clearance rates (43% to 100%) compared to 0.5% 5-FU (16.7% to 57.8%), but with increased adverse events. A split-face study showed equivalent efficacy (43% clearance) for both formulations, but 5% 5-FU had poorer tolerability.
population_specificity: Patients with multiple actinic keratoses (AKs) on the face and scalp.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of low-pressure liquid nitrogen endoscopic spray cryotherapy ablation in a large cohort across multiple study sites for esophageal dysplasia and neoplasia.
results_summary: The study found cryotherapy to be safe and well-tolerated, with common side effects like chest pain and dysphagia being short-lived. It demonstrated high efficacy, with complete regression of high-grade dysplasia in 94% of patients and complete regression of cancer in all early-stage cases.
population_specificity: Patients with Barrett's esophagus (with or without dysplasia), early-stage esophageal cancer, and severe squamous dysplasia.
study_duration: Patients were contacted between 1 and 10 days post-treatment, but the intervention duration is not detailed.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the neuroprotective and antioxidant effects of Cucurbita pepo in mitigating cuprizone-induced behavioral and histopathological changes in Wistar rats.
results_summary: C. pepo significantly improved motor coordination, reduced anxiety-like behavior, and decreased oxidative stress markers. Histopathological analysis showed reduced demyelination and enhanced neuronal integrity in treated groups.
population_specificity: Wistar rats with cuprizone-induced neurodegeneration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare different extraction methods (acid, electron beam irradiation, ultrasound, and combined methods) for pectin from spaghetti squash peel and evaluate their effects on yield, structure, and functional properties.
results_summary: The combined EBI and ultrasound extraction method yielded the highest pectin (13.50%) and produced pectin with low esterification, disrupted internal structure, reduced viscosity, and good functional properties like emulsification, antioxidant activity, and prebiotic effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on pectin extraction from spaghetti squash peel).
effective_dosage: Not specified (extraction methods described, but no dosage for human use).
study_duration: Not specified (study focused on extraction process, not intervention duration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore whether cryotherapy and antioxidant supplementation could attenuate the secondary inflammatory response in impact-induced muscle damage (IIMD) in athletes.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that cryotherapy may provide benefits in reducing inflammatory responses in IIMD, but the evidence is limited to animal contusion models, and further research is needed to establish its efficacy in human athletic populations.
population_specificity: Athletes involved in contact sports, particularly those exposed to impact-induced muscle damage (IIMD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the nephroprotective effects of Cucurbita pepo L. aerial parts methanolic extract against acrylamide-induced nephrotoxicity in rats.
results_summary: The study identified bioactive compounds in C. pepo, including stigmasterol and β-sitosterol, which restored kidney function markers, reduced oxidative stress, and lowered inflammatory cytokines in acrylamide-exposed rats. The extract demonstrated significant curative effects against nephrotoxicity.
population_specificity: Rats with acrylamide-induced nephrotoxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the combined application of zinc oxide nanoparticles (Nano-Zn) and moringa leaf extract (MLE) could mitigate the adverse effects of water deficit and saline soil conditions on squash (Cucurbita pepo) growth and physiological performance.
results_summary: The study found that sequential application of Nano-Zn (50 or 100 mg L-1) with MLE (3%) significantly improved plant growth, yield, photosynthetic efficiency, and antioxidant systems under water stress. The combined treatment was more effective than individual applications, reducing harmful H2O2 levels and increasing protective compounds like soluble sugars and amino acids.
population_specificity: Squash plants grown under water stress conditions in saline soil.
effective_dosage: 50 or 100 mg L-1 Nano-Zn with 3% MLE.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of an oral supplement containing Cucurbita pepo, among other ingredients, in improving hair density and appearance in patients with chronic telogen effluvium (CTE) and androgenetic alopecia (AGA).
results_summary: The supplement significantly increased hair density (9.9 hairs/cm² at 3 months and 12.3 hairs/cm² at 6 months) and improved overall hair volume compared to placebo. The supplement was well tolerated with no moderate or severe adverse events reported.
population_specificity: 80 patients aged 18-60 years with CTE or AGA.
effective_dosage: One capsule daily (specific Cucurbita pepo dosage not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of ultrasonic pretreatment and specific lactic acid bacteria strains on the quality of fermented pumpkin (Cucurbita pepo L.).
results_summary: Fermentation increased lactic acid bacteria counts, with ultrasonic pretreatment enhancing growth for L. rhamnosus. L. rhamnosus fermentation yielded higher lactic acid content and better sensory properties, while fermentation generally increased antioxidant capacity but reduced carotenoid and phenolic compounds.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory study on pumpkin samples).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Cucurbita pepo seed oil (CPSO) could modulate dyslipidemia and neuronal dysfunction induced by tramadol toxicity.
results_summary: CPSO significantly restored altered biochemical parameters (lipid profile and glutamate metabolism enzymes) in a dose-dependent manner, corroborated by histopathological findings, suggesting it can manage tramadol-induced dyslipidemia and neuronal dysfunction.
population_specificity: Albino rats (56 divided into seven groups of eight).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether agrochemical treatment (Oryzemate) could enhance the uptake of hydrophobic organic pollutants (e.g., pyrene) by Cucurbita pepo through upregulation of MLP genes, and assess its dual effects on phytoremediation and crop safety.
results_summary: Oryzemate treatment increased MLP levels in C. pepo roots and xylem sap, enhancing pyrene uptake in high-contamination soil but reducing it in low-contamination soil. Probenazole competitively inhibited MLP-pyrene binding, suggesting context-dependent effects on pollutant uptake.
population_specificity: Cucurbita pepo plants cultivated in high- and low-contamination soils.
interactions: Probenazole competitively inhibited MLP-pyrene binding in vitro.
